title: Erdős Problem #1128: Monochromatic Cubes in Cardinal Products
description: Let A, B, C have cardinality ℵ₁. Must any 2-coloring of A × B × C contain a countably infinite monochromatic cube A₁ × B₁ × C₁? DISPROVED by Prikry-Mills (1978): NO, such colorings exist with no ℵ₀ × ℵ₀ × ℵ₀ monochromatic cube.

overview.historicalContext: A problem of Erdős and Hajnal in partition calculus, asking whether the cardinal Ramsey property ℵ₁³ → (ℵ₀)³₂ holds. Prikry and Mills disproved it in 1978 with a counterexample, though their proof remained unpublished. The result was later documented by Todorčević (1994) and Komjáth (2025).
overview.problemStatement: Let A, B, C be three sets of cardinality ℵ₁. Is it true that in any 2-coloring of A × B × C, there must exist A₁ ⊂ A, B₁ ⊂ B, C₁ ⊂ C, all of cardinality ℵ₀, such that A₁ × B₁ × C₁ is monochromatic?
overview.proofStrategy: The formalization defines the cardinal setup, the coloring problem, and the monochromatic cube condition. The Prikry-Mills counterexample is stated as an axiom, showing that a 'bad' coloring exists that avoids all countably infinite monochromatic cubes.
keyInsights: The uncountability of ℵ₁ allows construction of 'bad' colorings
The counterexample uses ordinal structure to encode information
Finite Ramsey theory analogues hold, but infinite versions fail

sections.title: Summary and Status
sections.summary: Complete summary of the disproof, the main theorem showing the conjecture is false, and historical context.

conclusion.summary: Erdős Problem #1128 was DISPROVED by Prikry and Mills in 1978. The answer is NO: there exists a 2-coloring of ℵ₁ × ℵ₁ × ℵ₁ with no countably infinite monochromatic cube.
conclusion.implications: This negative result shows that infinite-dimensional Ramsey theory behaves very differently from the finite case. The uncountability of ℵ₁ allows encoding too much information for any ℵ₀ × ℵ₀ × ℵ₀ cube to be monochromatic.
openQuestions: What is the minimum cardinality κ such that κ³ → (ℵ₀)³₂?
Do large cardinal axioms affect these partition relations?
